Text:
SELECT NUMERIC_VAL FROM
    (
        SELECT R.NUMERIC_VAL, 'A' query /* query A */
        FROM TABLE_1  
        WHERE TABLE_1.DATE = TO_DATE('04/04/2012', 'DD/MM/YYYY') 
        UNION
        SELECT E.NUMBER_VALUE, 'B' query /* query B */
        FROM TABLE_2 
        WHERE TABLE_2.DATE = TO_DATE('05/04/2012', 'DD/MM/YYYY')
        UNION
        SELECT E.OTHER_NUMBER_VALUE, 'C' query /* query C */
        FROM TABLE_2
        WHERE TABLE_2.DATE = TO_DATE('05/04/2012', 'DD/MM/YYYY')
    ) T
    ORDER BY query

Though I don't see a way to do this reliably without the fake 2nd column, but this way at least it's not in the result. Also you might just try using `UNION ALL`, which means that it does not have to eliminate duplicate values, *likely* preserving order, but as I said, probably not reliably.

SELECT NUMERIC_VAL FROM
    (
        SELECT R.NUMERIC_VAL, 1 AS queryNo
        FROM TABLE_1  
        WHERE TABLE_1.DATE = TO_DATE('04/04/2012', 'DD/MM/YYYY') 
        UNION
        SELECT E.NUMBER_VALUE, 2 AS queryNo
        FROM TABLE_2 
        WHERE TABLE_2.DATE = TO_DATE('05/04/2012', 'DD/MM/YYYY')
        UNION
        SELECT E.OTHER_NUMBER_VALUE, 3 AS queryNo
        FROM TABLE_2
        WHERE TABLE_2.DATE = TO_DATE('05/04/2012', 'DD/MM/YYYY')
    ) T
    ORDER BY queryNo ASC

Though I don't see a way to do this reliably without the fake 2nd column, but this way at least it's not part of the result. Also you might just try using `UNION ALL`, which means that it does not have to eliminate duplicate values, *likely* preserving order, but as I said, probably not reliably.

SELECT NumVal FROM
    (
        SELECT R.NUMERIC_VAL AS NumVal, 1 AS queryNo
        FROM TABLE_1  
        WHERE TABLE_1.DATE = TO_DATE('04/04/2012', 'DD/MM/YYYY') 
        UNION
        SELECT E.NUMBER_VALUE AS NumVal, 2 AS queryNo
        FROM TABLE_2 
        WHERE TABLE_2.DATE = TO_DATE('05/04/2012', 'DD/MM/YYYY')
        UNION
        SELECT E.OTHER_NUMBER_VALUE AS NumVal, 3 AS queryNo
        FROM TABLE_2
        WHERE TABLE_2.DATE = TO_DATE('05/04/2012', 'DD/MM/YYYY')
    ) T
    ORDER BY queryNo ASC

Though I don't see a way to do this reliably without the fake 2nd column, but this way at least it's not part of the result. Also you might just try using `UNION ALL`, which means that it does not have to eliminate duplicate values, *likely* preserving order, but as I said, probably not reliably.
